name: Choosing the Right AWS Storage Service
description: Key scenarios for selecting the appropriate AWS storage service: EBS, S3, EFS, FSx, or EC2 Instance Store.

cards.front: You're building a high-throughput analytics application that processes large log files sequentially. Which AWS storage service is best suited for this workload?
cards.back: Use HDD-backed Amazon EBS volumes, which are ideal for throughput-intensive, sequential data access workloads such as big data and log processing.
cards.example: A data pipeline writes large log files to a Throughput Optimized HDD EBS volume for batch processing.
cards.subject: Choose the Right Storage Service

cards.front: You're hosting a temporary caching layer for a high-performance compute job. The data doesn't need to persist after instance termination. Which storage should you use?
cards.back: Use Amazon EC2 Instance Store, which is ephemeral and optimized for temporary, fast-changing data like caches and scratch files.
cards.example: An EC2 instance processes real-time video frames and stores temporary frame buffers in instance store volumes.
cards.subject: Choose the Right Storage Service

cards.front: You need highly durable storage for media files that are accessed occasionally and must be retained indefinitely. Which service best meets this need?
cards.back: Amazon S3 is best for media storage with high durability and scalability. It supports object storage for infrequently accessed but persistent data.
cards.example: A video production company archives its raw footage and final edits in Amazon S3 for long-term storage.
cards.subject: Choose the Right Storage Service

cards.front: Your application requires a shared file system accessible from multiple EC2 instances. Which AWS storage option should you choose?
cards.back: Use Amazon EFS or Amazon FSx, both of which support file storage that can be mounted by multiple EC2 instances.
cards.example: A microservices app uses Amazon EFS for shared configuration files across services running on separate EC2 instances.
cards.subject: Choose the Right Storage Service

cards.front: You're running a database on EC2 that requires consistent, fast read/write access and needs to persist through reboots. Which storage service fits best?
cards.back: Amazon EBS (SSD-backed) is best for persistent, transactional workloads like databases. It offers fast IOPS and retains data after instance reboots.
cards.example: A MySQL database stores its data files on a Provisioned IOPS SSD EBS volume for high throughput.
cards.subject: Choose the Right Storage Service
